items.q: I wake up at 7 a.m., and the ____________________ (first / finally / later) thing I do is have breakfast.
____________________ (Next week / Last week / Later week) is going to be busy.
I'm almost finished getting dressed, so I'll be ready ____________________ (in a minute / next / later).
We're going to Paris ____________________ (then / next year / after that).
She'll be twenty years old ____________________ (next Monday / later / then).
I ____________________ flowers to Annie's party tomorrow. (bring, negative)
We ____________________ the bus downtown when we finish our homework. (take, affirmative)
She ____________________ the piano as soon as she gets home from school. (practice, affirmative)
The weather ____________________ very nice tomorrow. (be, negative)
They ____________________ abroad next year. (travel, negative)
I'm tired, so I think I ____________________ to bed now. (go, affirmative)
My father ____________________ me the money to buy a car. (give, negative)
They ____________________ home tonight since there is a good movie playing at the theater. (stay, negative)
The paint ____________________ because it is very warm today. (dry, affirmative)
I ____________________ any dessert because I ate a big dinner. (have, negative)
We saw a orangutan in a tree at the zoo. ____________________
The San Diego Zoo is a largest zoo in the United States. ____________________
A brown dog that lives next door seems to be sick. ____________________
My parents bought me an new puppy for my birthday. ____________________
Hugh has always wanted to have the pet snake. ____________________
Where does your family usually go for summer ________________________ ?
Please don't ________________________ about your doctor's appointment tomorrow.
Owls and bats are two ________________________ animals that fly in the night.
Is there a nice shop around here where I can buy a birthday ________________________ ?
The drive ________________________ the coast of California is beautiful.
I ________________________ ever go to the gym because I'm too busy.
George enjoys ________________________ on the trails in Yellowstone National Park.
Although you're going to New York on business, I hope you'll find time to visit the ________________________ .
Do you have a ________________________ minutes to talk with me?
The Pantheon is an ________________________ temple in Rome.
John ____ in China next fall. a. will to study b. is going to study c. going to study d. is to study
____ you while you're there. a. Your family is going to visit b. Your family will to visit c. Is your family going to visit d. Is going to visit your family
____ until next semester. a. I am will graduate b. I am will not graduate c. I will not graduate d. I am not going graduate
The train ____ on schedule. a. isn't going to depart b. won't going to depart c. isn't going to will d. isn't will going to depart
____ their parents tonight. a. They going to call b. They will to call c. They will calling d. They are going to call
"It's been ten years since I've seen you!"
"Bermuda is the perfect place to relax."
"I hate when you do that!"
"These dinosaur bones are more than 2,000 years old."
"How wonderful of you to give me diamond earrings and a necklace!"
"He's my mother's brother's son."
"You got the job? Let's have a party!"
"For this event men should wear suits and black ties."
"I want to talk to you today about the state of our economy."
"You really want my opinion? Actually, I don't think it's a very good hair cut."
Steve lost car keys at the mall. _________________________________
It takes me an hour to finish homework. _________________________________
They're going to visit White House next week. _________________________________
Please give me ideas for the science project. I don't have any. _________________________________
We are not going on vacation this summer. We don't have enough money. _________________________________
My brother won't help me move my furniture this weekend. He has to work. _________________________________
The veterinarian is going to give my cat some medicine. The cat is sick. _________________________________
Because of the snowstorm. Judy's flight was delayed. _________________________________
I am going to be late for work. My car broke down. _________________________________
( to study / I have / to the library / for my exam / because / I am going ) ____________________________________________________________
( the house / his parents / to visit / Jason is cleaning / are coming / because ) ____________________________________________________________
( Martha is going / to sell it soon / because / to paint / she plans / her house ) ____________________________________________________________
( because / is being repaired / to school tomorrow / I need / my car / a ride ) ____________________________________________________________
( eat meat / because / are going / we / I don't / to a vegetarian restaurant ) ____________________________________________________________
Alicia and Tom are going to the beach. Because they want to go swimming.
Do you want to eat lunch? Because I'm really hungry.
They won't be going to the meeting because she broke her leg.
Because you're smart. You always do well on tests.
She's calling the doctor because her daughter has a high fever.
Think about your schedule for the next week. What are your plans? Use will and be going to in your sentences.
